subsections.title: Basics
subsections.label: subsec:basics-passive
prompts: Explain the fundamental role of a resistor in a DC circuit and how it opposes the flow of current.
Describe the construction and function of a potentiometer, including its use as an adjustable volume control.
Discuss the concept of capacitance and how a capacitor stores energy in an electric field.
Explain the construction of a capacitor, focusing on the conductive surfaces separated by an insulator.
Describe the function of an inductor and how it stores energy in a magnetic field.
Explain the typical construction of an inductor as a coil of wire and its role in circuits.
Discuss the function of an SPDT switch and how it differs from other types of switches.
Explain the purpose of a fuse in protecting circuit components from current overloads.
Compare and contrast rechargeable and non-rechargeable battery chemistries, providing examples of each.
Describe the characteristics of a single-pole single-throw switch and its representation in circuit diagrams.
